title: Call 12 VIP's
description: Use the FORD script to do check-in calls

title: Call & update everyone involved in an active transaction
description: Provide a status call to your active sellers, buyers, lenders, title companies, attorneys, insurance, inspectors, etc

title: Reach out to your hot and old leads
description: The goal is to close for an appointment

title: Call 12 past clients
description: Use the FORD script to do check-in calls

title: Call 10 vendors and 2 builders
description: The goal is to set up 2 discovery meetings

title: Schedule 1 lunch/coffee meeting with a VIP
description: Take someone from your VIP list out to lunch or coffee

title: Complete Goals Planner
description: Mark as complete once you've finished

title: Take the SuccessIndex Assessment
description: Mark as complete once you've finished

title: Do an Overall Business Reflection
description: Reflect on current business state, what's working, what isn't, and 12-month goals

title: Write Vision and Mission Statements
description: Define where you want your business to be in 1, 3, 5 years (Vision) and your purpose/impact (Mission)

title: Identify 5 Key Focus Areas
description: List 5 key business areas to focus on this year from the Business Planning lesson

title: Set SMART Goals for Each Focus Area
description: Create specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound goals for each focus area

title: Break Goals into Tactics & Identify Dependencies
description: Break each goal into actionable steps and identify required resources, tools, or support

title: Define Measures of Success for each Tactic
description: Define measurable outcomes and targets for each goal

title: Set Timelines with Milestones
description: Create deadlines for each goal and outline key milestones using timeline template

title: Conduct a Time Audit
description: Track daily activities for one week and categorize as productive, non-productive, or personal

title: Complete Time Audit Summary Chart & Reflection
description: Total time spent in each category and answer reflection questions about productivity

title: Implement Action Plan to Optimize Time
description: List distraction-limiting strategies you'll implement

title: Add Weekly Time-Blocked Calendar to Devices
description: Create time-blocked weekly calendar using provided template

title: List Distraction-Limiting Strategies
description: Identify and list strategies to minimize distractions during work

title: Accountability Planning
description: Reflect on implementation challenges and identify accountability methods

title: Complete Pillar 1 Checklist
description: Review that you've completed vision/mission, focus areas, SMART goals, tactics, metrics, deadlines, time-blocking, distraction strategies

title: Create Your 3 Master Lists
description: Compile 50 each of Referral Partners, VIP People, and Past Clients from contacts/social/email

title: Assess Relationship Strength
description: Use assessment questions for each lead; invest time in strengthening weak relationships

title: Optimize Social Media Profiles
description: Use professional photo, ensure bio includes title, location, contact info, and add CTA link for name and email

title: Create a Linktree or Single Landing Page for Social Media
description: Create a central link that you'll use as your website link on all social media profiles

title: Engage on Social Media
description: Spend 10-15 minutes liking, commenting, responding, and using direct messages

title: Identify and Leverage Referral Partners
description: Identify current top referral partners and create partnership plans

title: CRM Workflow Implementation
description: Complete 8-step CRM setup including import, organization, automation, and maintenance

title: Complete Pillar 2 Checklist
description: Build 500-contact database, use posting schedule daily, implement lead process, log/categorize all leads, cultivate referral partners

title: Define Your Unique Value Proposition (UVP)
description: Complete UVP framework to refine your sales pitch

title: Practice and Rehearse Your Sales Pitch
description: Write and rehearse your pitch using the provided template

title: Objection Handling Exercises
description: Practice using objection-handling scripts and role-play scenarios

title: Memorize and Present Buyer's Advantage Program
description: Learn and incorporate top five advantages into buyer consultations

title: Incorporate Forever Fans Program in Consultation Materials
description: Include program flyer in all consultation packets

title: Complete Pillar 4 Checklist
description: Review UVP, pitch, objection scripts, client programs, Worry-Free Addendum, and negotiation techniques

title: Organize and Segment Your Database Using CRM
description: Create a CRM tagging system to label each contact appropriately

title: Add to Calendar to Hold Daily Team Meetings
description: Assign priorities, review progress, delegate using Big Rocks meeting structure

title: Update Revenue Tracker
description: Record income and categorize expenses weekly

title: Weekly Transaction Review
description: Dedicate time in meetings to review status of all active deals

title: Complete Pillar 5 Checklist
description: Review CRM organization, delegation, meetings, financial tracking, transaction management, automation

title: Identify and Categorize Referral Partners
description: Use Power Unit Referral Partner List template to identify and categorize top referral partners

title: Communicate Referral Expectations with Scripts
description: Role-play referral conversations to build confidence using provided scripts

title: Implement Referral Moments in Client Interactions
description: Recognize trigger phrases, respond with referral ask, set expectation early

title: Implement 12-Month Client Gift Plan
description: Schedule and deliver monthly gifts to clients/partners using provided table

title: Identify High-Value Whale Clients and Deliver Premium Gifts
description: Create budget and identify high-value contacts for premium whale gifts

title: Set Up Automated Email Campaigns for Referrals
description: Use CRM to set up automated emails for regular touches with past clients/partners

title: Complete Pillar 6 Checklist
description: Ensure you've identified partners, scheduled check-ins, follow-up, sent gifts, held events, practiced referral asks

title: Review trending real estate podcasts and subscribe to one
description: Subscribe to several trending real estate podcasts and select one to subscribe for ongoing industry insights and strategies

title: Film a video introducing yourself for Instagram
description: Record a short video sharing who you are, what problem do your ideal clients have, and how you help them solve it

title: Attend a virtual industry webinar or workshop
description: Register for and actively participate in an online real estate webinar to learn new trends or tools

title: Research last monthâ€™s sales trends in your area
description: Review local MLS and market reports to identify patterns, price shifts, and active neighborhoods

title: Preview 2 homes on the market
description: Schedule and tour two available listings to stay updated on current inventory and features.

title: Post a poll about home-buying trends on LinkedIn.
description: Create a LinkedIn poll asking your network about their top home-buying priorities or challenges.

title: Touch base with mortgage partners for new rates
description: Reach out to lending partners to get updates on mortgage rate changes and special programs.

title: Scout a local event for networking opportunities.
description: Attend a community event or professional mixer to meet new contacts for potential referrals

title: Analyze rental market pricing charts for your county
description: Examine current rental data and pricing trends to advise investors and renters accurately

title: Update Google My Business profile info
description: Log in to Google My Business and refresh your contact information, photos, and reviews.

title: Join a local Chamber of Commerce meeting
description: Attend a Chamber gathering to forge relationships with local business leaders and professionals.

title: Tour a newly built development
description: Schedule an appointment to meet with a new home sales representative for a community in your market

title: Write a market update blog post
description: Draft and publish a blog post summarizing the latest local market data and insights.

title: Host a live Q&A about homebuying
description: Go live on social media to answer audience questions about buying a home in your market

title: Update email signature with latest branding
description: Edit your email signature to include updated contact info, branding colors, and links

title: Attend a mortgage/finance training.
description: Participate in a finance-related workshop or class to expand your understanding of lending products

title: Join a Facebook group for local professionals.
description: Search for and join a business-oriented Facebook group in your area to connect and share insights.

title: Inspirational Post
description: Kickstart the week with a positive, motivational message that resonates with your audience's goals.

title: Sunday Brunch Spot
description: Share a popular local brunch spot from the weekend to showcase community involvement and lifestyle.

title: Market Update
description: Establish your expertise first thing Sunday with a key statistic or trend about the local market.

title: Client Need
description: Turn your network into your source of leads by clearly stating who your ideal client is and who you can help.

title: Relocation
description: Position yourself as the expert for newcomers by highlighting your ability to help people moving to the area.

title: Apartment Lease
description: Tap into the rental market and future buyer pipeline by showcasing 1 available apartment rental.

title: Listing of the Day
description: Generate excitement and buyer interest for en active listing from your brokerage.

title: Website Promotion
description: Post a link to your website to drive traffic and boost your search engine visibility.

title: All About YOU
description: Build know-like-trust by sharing a personal story, passion, or what drives you as an agent.

title: Client Feature
description: Build social proof and celebrate a client's success with a testimonial or closing story. Use pictures or video if possible.

title: Open House Promotion
description: Promote a weekend open house (if you're hosting one) or if one is being held at one of your listings.

title: Tour Video
description: Post a property tour video to generate online engagement and buyer interest.

title: City Weekend Event
description: Provide value as a community resource by sharing a local event happening over the weekend.

title: Throwback Thursday
description: Share a nostalgic photo or story from your past

title: Industry News
description: Demonstrate you're a well-informed professional by sharing some relevant industry news.

title: Referral/Thank You Post
description: Publicly appreciate a past client or partner, which encourages future referrals.

title: Listing of the Day
description: Re-engage weekend scrollers with by highlighting a listing from your inventory or your brokerage's.

title: Open House Reminder
description: Post a last-call reminder for your open house happening that day.

title: Listing of the Day
description: Feature a "dream home" or standout property to capture weekend buyer attention.

title: Your City Fun Fact
description: Share a piece of local trivia to reinforce your love and knowledge of the area.

title: Event Photo
description: Document your community involvement by sharing a photo from a local event you attended.

title: Share Someone Else's Post
description: Show that you are active and engaged by sharing someone else's post that your audience would like.

title: Thanks For Your Support
description: End the week on a grateful note by thanking your followers for their engagement and support.

title: Update P&L Statements Monthly
description: Use P&L statement template to find areas for improvement and set financial goals

title: Develop Quarterly Budget
description: Create quarterly budget using provided templates

title: Audit and Automate Routine Back Office Tasks
description: Identify repetitive tasks to automate for efficiency

title: Host an Educational Seminar
description: No description provided

title: Host a Client Appreciation Event
description: No description provided

title: Attend a Charity Event
description: No description provided

title: Host a Networking Happy Hour
description: No description provided

title: Send your Monthly Small Gift
description: No description provided

title: Send your Letter of the Heart
description: No description provided

title: Send your Evidence of Success Marketing Piece
description: No description provided

title: Mail Out Your Monthly Referral Rewards
description: No description provided

title: Mail Out Your Monthly Birthday Cards
description: No description provided

title: Mail Out Your Monthly Anniversary Cards
description: No description provided

title: Send Your High-Value Contact Gifts
description: No description provided

title: Submit Your Agent Success Journal
description: No description provided

title: Update Your Profit & Loss Statement
description: No description provided

title: Update Your Revenue Tracker
description: No description provided

title: Host & Attend Your Daily Meeting
description: No description provided

title: Review Your Daily Schedule
description: No description provided

title: Collect a New Testimonial
description: No description provided

title: Text 5 people you know about your real estate license
description: Send a simple text to 5 friends/family: "Hey! I got my real estate license and am helping people buy/sell homes. Keep me in mind if you hear of anyone looking!"

title: Post "I'm a realtor" story on social media
description: Create an Instagram/Facebook story with your license photo and text: "Officially a licensed realtor! DM me if you're thinking of buying or selling!"

title: Walk one neighborhood for 30 minutes
description: Pick a neighborhood you want to work and walk for 30 minutes. Take photos of 3 homes, note price ranges, and post about the area on social media.

title: Send handwritten note to 5 past connections
description: Write 5 handwritten notes to former colleagues, classmates, or neighbors. Simple message: "Thinking of you! I'm now helping people with real estate - let me know if I can help you or anyone you know."

title: Door knock 10 homes in expired listing area
description: Find an area with expired listings and door knock 10 homes. Script: "Hi, I noticed homes in this area were on the market recently. Are you still thinking of selling? I have ideas that might help."

title: Create neighborhood Instagram Reel
description: Film a 30-second Reel walking through a neighborhood, highlighting 3 cool features. Use trending audio and hashtags like #[YourCity]Homes #LocalRealtor.

title: Record a local market update video
description: Film a 2-minute video sharing 3 recent home sales in your area. Post on social media with: "Here's what's happening in [Neighborhood] real estate this week!"

title: Follow up with 10 leads from last month
description: Call or text 10 people who showed interest previously but didn't move forward. Script: "Hi [Name], checking in on your home search/sale. Anything new I can help with?"

title: Host an open house for another agent
description: Contact 3 agents and offer to host their open house this weekend. Collect visitor information and follow up with attendees about their home search.

title: Write hyperlocal blog post about neighborhood
description: Write a 500-word blog post about a specific neighborhood: schools, amenities, recent sales. Title it "Why [Neighborhood Name] is Perfect for [Type of Buyer]."

title: Launch Facebook ads for buyer leads
description: Set up a $10/day Facebook ad targeting renters in your area with: "Tired of throwing money away on rent? Let me show you how to buy with as little as 3% down."

title: Schedule 5 listing appointments this week
description: Contact expired listings, FSBOs, and old leads to schedule 5 listing presentations this week. Focus on homes that have been on market 30+ days.

title: Launch "Just Listed" video marketing campaign
description: Create professional listing video and boost it on social media targeting neighbors within 1 mile. Budget $50 to reach potential sellers who might be inspired to list.

title: Create neighborhood price analysis report
description: Analyze recent sales in target neighborhood and create professional report: "Q4 Market Analysis: [Neighborhood Name]". Share with 100+ homeowners in area.

title: Launch weekly market update newsletter
description: Create weekly email newsletter with local market stats, new listings, and sold properties. Send to 200+ contacts and promote subscription on social media.

title: Call 3 "Coming Soon" listings today
description: Find 3 "Coming Soon" listings and call the listing agents. Ask if they need buyers and offer to show the property to your qualified clients.

title: Update social media bio with recent success
description: Update your Instagram/Facebook bio with your latest win: "Just helped the Johnson family find their dream home!" Include a call-to-action to DM you.

title: Send thank you video to recent client
description: Record a 30-second thank you video for your most recent client and post it (with permission) on social media to show your appreciation and professionalism.

title: Post before/after staging photos
description: If you have any listings being staged, post before/after photos on social media with: "The power of staging! Which photo would make you want to see more?"

title: Follow up with 5 old leads via video text
description: Send personalized video texts to 5 old leads: "Hey [Name], I know it's been a while but I wanted to check in about your real estate goals. Anything new?"

title: Create "Sold" celebration post
description: Take a photo with your "SOLD" sign and happy clients (if they agree). Post with: "Another family helped! If you're thinking of buying or selling, let's chat!"

title: Post local restaurant recommendation
description: Post about your favorite local restaurant with: "Love supporting local businesses in [City]! If you're new to the area, this is a must-try spot!"

title: Send market update to 10 past clients
description: Text or email 10 past clients with: "Your home has gained $X in value since you bought it! Would you like a detailed report?" Include their address for personalization.

title: Create "New Listing Alert" story series
description: When you get a new listing, create a 3-story Instagram series: 1) "Just Listed!" 2) Tour highlights 3) "DM me for showing!" Use location tags.

title: Call 10 homeowners who bought 2-3 years ago
description: Use public records to find recent buyers (2-3 years ago) and call to ask: "How are you enjoying your home? Are you thinking about any improvements or upgrades?"

title: Share neighborhood school rankings post
description: Research and post about local school ratings: "Parents looking in [Area]! Here are the top-rated schools and their boundaries. Great info for families!"

title: Create first-time buyer tip post
description: Post helpful first-time buyer tip: "First-time buyers: You can buy with as little as 3% down! Don't let rent money go to waste - let's explore your options!"

title: Call 3 "For Sale By Owner" listings today
description: Find 3 FSBO listings on Craigslist/Facebook and call to offer free market analysis. Script: "Hi, I saw your home for sale. I'd love to provide a free market analysis to help you price it right."

title: Introduce yourself to 2 local business owners
description: Visit 2 businesses near your target area. Introduce yourself as the new realtor, leave a business card, and ask if they know anyone looking to buy/sell.

title: Set up Google Alert for your target neighborhood
description: Create a Google Alert for "[Your Neighborhood Name] real estate" and "[Your Neighborhood Name] homes for sale" to stay informed of local news and opportunities.

title: Comment on 10 local Facebook group posts
description: Join local Facebook groups and comment helpfully on 10 posts related to moving, home improvements, or neighborhood questions. Add value, don't sell.

title: Call 5 rental property managers
description: Contact 5 rental property managers in your area. Offer to help their investors with buying more properties or tenants who want to buy their first home.

title: Attend one local networking event this week
description: Find and attend one Chamber of Commerce meeting, business mixer, or community event. Set goal to meet 5 new people and collect 5 business cards.

title: Partner with local coffee shop for referrals
description: Visit a popular local coffee shop and offer to provide "New Resident Welcome Bags" for their customers who just moved to the area. Leave your cards there.

title: Call 20 sphere contacts about referrals
description: Contact 20 people in your sphere. Ask: "Who do you know that might be thinking about buying or selling real estate in the next 6 months?"

title: Send market report to 50 contacts
description: Create a simple one-page market report with local stats and email/text it to 50 contacts with: "Thought you'd find this interesting! Let me know if you have questions."

title: Cold call 25 homeowners in target area
description: Use skip trace to call 25 homeowners in your target neighborhood. Script: "Hi, I'm the local realtor for [Area]. I have buyers looking in your neighborhood. Any chance you've considered selling?"

title: Contact 10 divorce attorneys for referrals
description: Call 10 divorce attorneys in your area. Offer to be their go-to realtor for clients who need to sell homes quickly and fairly during divorce proceedings.

title: Host investor meetup at local restaurant
description: Organize a monthly real estate investor meetup. Invite 20 investors, promote on BiggerPockets and Facebook. Position yourself as the investor-friendly agent.

title: Circle prospect around new listing
description: Within 24 hours of getting a new listing, door knock or mail 100 neighbors with "Your neighbor at [Address] just listed with me. I have buyers looking in your area!"

title: Partner with 3 lenders for joint marketing
description: Contact 3 mortgage lenders to create joint first-time buyer seminars. Split costs on marketing and leads. Each of you brings different expertise.

title: Speak at local business organization
description: Contact Chamber of Commerce, Rotary, or business groups to speak about "Real Estate Market Outlook" or "Investment Opportunities in [Your City]."

title: Launch referral partner incentive program
description: Create formal referral program for past clients: $500 gift card for referred buyers, $1000 for referred sellers. Announce via email blast and social media.

title: Contact local news about market trends
description: Reach out to local news stations/papers to position yourself as market expert. Offer to comment on housing trends, interest rates, or local development news.

title: Text everyone who liked your recent post
description: Go through your recent social media posts and personally text everyone who liked/commented: "Thanks for the support! Let me know if you ever have real estate questions!"

title: Research and contact 5 high-net-worth prospects
description: Use public records to find 5 homeowners with $500K+ homes who bought 5-7 years ago. Call to ask if they're considering upgrading or downsizing.

title: Leave door hangers in target neighborhood
description: Print 50 door hangers with "Thinking of selling? I just sold a home on your street!" and distribute them in neighborhoods with recent sales.

title: Contact 3 estate sale companies
description: Call local estate sale companies and offer to help families who need to sell inherited homes quickly. Leave your card and information packet.

title: Visit 5 businesses to drop off business cards
description: Stop by 5 local businesses (coffee shops, dry cleaners, salons) and introduce yourself. Ask if you can leave business cards for their customers.

title: Contact 5 moving companies for partnerships
description: Call 5 local moving companies to build referral relationships. Offer to recommend them to clients in exchange for referrals when people are relocating.
